result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Ann Herzog was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $236.00 to Alexander M. or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived; costs and surcharges that can not be waived are to be paid during the term of probation.

Mental health assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Court recommends this matter be transferred to the Mental Health Unit of the probation department.
Successfully complete parenting classes.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley Ann Herzog

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin and student intern Solomon Gatton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court granted state's motion for adjournment of sentencing to allow victim to be notified.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  For reasons stated on the record the defense is not ready to proceed. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense advised the court that this matter will be resolved with a DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog not in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Alexander M.

Defendant Ashley Ann Herzog in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
